definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed

sentences.english: GENIE :When you rud the magic lamp , I will give you four wishes .
sentences.chinese: 当你擦亮神灯，我将给你四个愿望。

sentences.english: This process aligns the liquid crystal molecules parallel to the buffing direction.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程调整好与擦亮平行的液晶分子方向。

sentences.english: If you furbish up these old chairs you'll have a better chance of selling them.
sentences.chinese: 你要是把这些旧椅子擦亮，就会更好卖些。

sentences.english: They waxed and buffed the floor .
sentences.chinese: 他们将地板打蜡并擦亮。

sentences.english: He watched as the brothers completed their entrance and positioned themselves before polished oak pews.
sentences.chinese: 他看着武士们全部进场安坐在擦亮的橡木长凳上。

sentences.english: Cleanse your eyes, so that you behold no man as different from yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 擦亮眼睛，不要以为别人与自己不一样。

sentences.english: He was then bright in the eye.
If you furbish up these old chairs,you'll have a better chance of selling them.
sentences.chinese: 你要是把这些旧椅子擦亮，就会更好卖。

sentences.english: He polished the silver until it gleamed.
sentences.chinese: 他擦亮银器直到它闪烁。

sentences.english: But it's my job, Your Highness. I'm the royal crown polisher.
sentences.chinese: 但那是我的工作，我的职责就是擦亮它。

sentences.english: A Benefit brow wax is the fastest way to look polished, pretty and put-together.
sentences.chinese: 好处眉毛蜡是看的最快的方法擦亮，相当和综合起来。

sentences.english: He brightens the brass knocker with a piece of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他用一块布擦亮铜门环。

sentences.english: Buff up the paintwork with a soft cloth.
sentences.chinese: 用块柔软的布把漆面擦亮。

sentences.english: Polish your shoes with a brush before going out.
sentences.chinese: 翻译出门前，把鞋子擦亮。

sentences.english: He wears the same things for weeks, but makes sure his weapons are clean.
sentences.chinese: 他几周都不换衣服，但一定确保擦亮他的武器。

sentences.english: Trying to get the silverware clean we have to exert ourselves to rub away for hours.
sentences.chinese: 为把银器擦亮，我们必须花几个小时很费劲地擦拭。

definition: to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
